docs.abstract: Dr Edwin A Salsitz, Beth Israel Medical Center addiction medicine specialist, letter on April 6 article about use of smokeless tobacco products supports use of alternatives to reduce risks for those unable to quit smoking (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: To The Editor: Re ''A Smokeless Alternative to Quitting'' (April 6): I agree that smokeless tobacco products can help cigarette smokers reduce the risks to their health. Another important public health benefit is the elimination of secondhand smoke, and therefore passive smoking, by the nonsmoker.

headline.main: Rejecting Constitutional Claims, Judge Upholds Smoking Bans

docs.abstract: Federal Judge Victor Marrero upholds smoking ban in New York City and New York State bars and restaurants, ruling that laws do not conflict with freedom of speech, travel or other protected rights (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge in Manhattan has upheld the smoking bans that the city and state enacted last year. In a widely expected decision released yesterday, Judge Victor Marrero of the United States Court for the Southern District of New York ruled that the bans do not unduly burden smokers' rights to freedom of speech, association, travel or any other protected privileges.
